name: Louis Rose
biography:
Louis leads the Mutiny project. He directs a research programme on mutation testing at the University of York, where he is a lecturer in software engineering.

He likes running (very slowly), learning (quite slowly) and finding bugs (quickly).

name: Tim Waterson
biography: Tim is making it straightforward to apply Mutiny as part of a typical develop-test-build-deploy cycle.

name: Katherine Smith
biography: Katherine is applying user-centered design and interaction modelling techniques to mutation testing, and delivering an improved user experience for Mutiny.

name: Liam Mullane
biography: Liam is adding adding state-of-the-art equivalent mutant detection to Mutiny, which will improve its effectiveness, scalability and usability.

name: James Shaw
biography:
James is generalising the mutation engine in Mutiny so that it can be used for software written in more than one language.

A keen sportsman, he enjoys playing tennis and attempting to find his way around a golf course, albeit in a rather zig-zag fashion!

name: Katie Mills
biography: Katie is analysing recently proposed techniques for speeding up mutation testing, and extending Mutiny to incorporate the most performant of these techniques.
